Reviews.Title: “Value forMoney”
Reviews.Author: tgsantos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 81 Bencoolen in Singapore and it was our first trip to SG . One of the plus points of the hotel is its great and convinient location. There's 7-11 and Kopitiam ( 24 hrs open) right across the hotel and a few meters away is the train station which can take you all around SG. All around the hotel are schools and museums worth visiting! Room was clean although you have to bring your own toilteries as they will offer you next to nothing. I would have given it a perfect rating except for its staff at the Front Counter. Not one single soul was friendly. They will give you your room key and that's it! And don't bother to ask directions from them. They either don't care what you're asking about or they do not know where you're going! But what the heck! Go stay at Hotel 81 Bencoolen and just enjoy yourselves!! Its still conviniently located. Oh, and you can take the Bus at the corner when leaving as it will take you straight to the Airport!

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Cheaper than most Singapore hotels. Hint if you do stay here ask for a higher floor due to construction of new subway until 2017. Free WiFi. THE BAD: Only one front desk staff member was helpful, all others clearly didn't want to deal with people. Cleaning staff were so noisy in the early morning didn't need an alarm. Also other staff who seemed to live on our floor were up and down the hallways, yelling, banging in the corridor until 2 am every night. The beds are made of vinyl which is miserable to sleep on. Didn't get any sleep the entire stay. The floor was never swept, the bathroom is very dated, shower was never cleaned. Asked for an extra pillow, never got one. Asked about advertised tours on their website, was given a dirty look and told they don't book tours. Then ignored my further requests for tours. Staff doesn't smile, most people in Singapore don't. Here's an idea, if you don't like foreigners then get another job. THE UGLY: The location is mediocre. Nothing to see until you get to Marina Bay. Little india is a waste of time, Chinatown is good for a visit, the only nice part of Singapore is Marina. And the shopping is as expensive as Canada with the same stores so what's the point of buying. Not impressed with this hotel and not impressed with Singapore. People are very rude and the city is just a big shopping mall. Food is greasy everywhere. Tried eating at high end restauraunts, hawker centers, food courts, and street meat, only good meal had the entire time was Italian. And we both love asian cuisine. Skip and go to Kuala Lumpur instead.

Reviews.Title: “good location - don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: Good location close to MRT Circle line. Rooms are small and not very clean. Felt cramped. Bed was hard and sleep wasn't very comfortable. There are other places - i should have known better.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: NDarya
Reviews.Content: This is standard accommodation that you get for that amount of money in Singapore. So, I didn't expect much right from the start. But the reality was even worse than my low expectations. Rooms are tiny and stinky. Walls are covered with mold. Windows can't be opened and you won't even want to do that as the view is just bad. There is a constructions right in front of the hotel so I only asked for a room which didn't overlook that. Overall, the stay was far from pleasant. The good thing is that the hotel is close to MRT station from which you can go anywhere you want and there are some good places to have breaksfast nearby. Staff was fine. so, I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody unless you don't care at all.

Reviews.Title: “If you need a place to sleep ...”
Reviews.Author: Nara77
Reviews.Content: ... for one or two nights, it's ok. For longer, no thanks. Not really that good price, considering what you get. Rooms are very small, windows can't be opened, there is a construction site just outside the hotel. The beds are hard, the room wasnt't good cleaned. On the good side: the staff is friendly and helpful, and the location is good. Wifi worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Little tips”
Reviews.Author: ori_bz
Reviews.Content: Construction outside the hotel - make sure to avoid the construction side which is rooms : 02-11 (checked on 14th floor) You can't open the windows on high floors if you have an issue there be advised ( or bring a screwdriver ;) Beds are fairly hard and pillows disappointingly uncomfy. Location was already debated as was the tendency of the toilet floor to be a bit unclean .…

Reviews.Title: “Good for the budget...”
Reviews.Author: Louieboytoy
Reviews.Content: I've chosen this hotel as I already spent most of my money when I had my cruise via Star Cruise (SG-Malaysia). The hotel is just infront of Bayview Hotel (where I stayed during my most recent visit to SG). The hotel's staff is a bit friendly. In terms of cleanlness, i can say its fine. They have a comfortable bed and clean restroom and they have cable TV as well. The hotel is just walking distance away from the shopping area/malls.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service level still maintain”
Reviews.Author: WeilekHo
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to stay in this hotel, first time was 6 years ago. The hotel doesn’t change much. However, there was much more amazing for me to discover. Initial I though the closer MRT station was Dhoby Ghaut (which the important station for 2 lines interchange), in fact the nearer station is Bras Basah (Circle line, new line and also end to Dhoby Ghaut). Bras Basah station just next to food court in the junction. I also visited the new casino Marina Bay Sands, there is a direct bus no. 106 connecting to Bras Basah NTUC bus station. Future, it can be accessed by MRT Circle line. This time I am being observer carefully any changes compare with last time. Basically it doesn’t change much, I am still easy to recognize the road and the building near by, searching easily. It is close to YMCA, and the whole street is having many hotels from budget range to luxury (Bay View, Strand Hotel, Ibis, Bancoolen Hotel, Rendezvous hotel and etc), really no worry for comparison among the same location. We were stayed in the pent house, is having a great city view. The hotel provide basic needs with drinking water and coffee 3-1, room is small and still using CRT TV, can not compare with those ranging hotel and we are paying low rate. I realized the queen bed is smaller than normal, recommend to have twin single bed. Wifi service is provided with password, renew everyday. Maybe it is pent house and close to aircond compressor and water heater, a bit noisy to my room. The location is very near to Orchard road and Bugis, within walking distance. As mentioned, one food court at the junction and opposite is 7-11 24hrs convenience shop. Is really an idea hotel to stay with reasonable price. Have to emphasize, it is a low cost hotel, can not be so demanding, what you paid and what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Rajesh M
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are very neat and clean and i dont it call center of location but close enought to Dobhi ghat metro station from where u can reach any part of singapore! good for bachelors there is also 7/11 store opp to hotel easy for beer, at kopthiam u can watch football with other enthusiasts on big street screen which is really fun and enjoy the evening! ..

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms and poor room service/ hygine”
Reviews.Author: Kunalg28
Reviews.Content: Very small room. Hardly any space other then the bed. Bed sheet were not very clean, were torn and not even covering the whole bed. Noisy at night at times. Only good thing is central location and very close to 2 MRT stations.

Reviews.Title: “Family room a bit small but ok for the budget”
Reviews.Author: sahge
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant at first due to the numerous bad reviews about the hotel. But since we are mostly out and just plan to use the room to sleep, we agreed to try it anyway. If you are looking for a budget friendly hotel with good location, try this one!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: simple_living1220
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably the cheapest within the area. It has a good location as it is near the MRT station and a mile walk to orchard road. But when we stayed here this month, the street was closed due to road construction. So if youre staying at lower floors, the noise from the construction might annoy you. And i dont have any idea how long it will last. Another thing they need to improve on is there service (warmth). They are very much robotic and they need to improve on their smile! They are accomodating but they need to go an extra mile for service.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive city renders low value for your hotel dollar”
Reviews.Author: KevandJho
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore on two seperate occasions and stayed both times at the Hotel 81. On one occasion for a mere 5 hours as to accomodate a connecting flight to Manila the next day. Singapore isn't a city for those on a budget and $120 a night here gets you very, very little.I guess we got spoiled by the great value we got from recent Thailand,Malaysia, Indonesia and Philippine stayovers. What we got was a very tiny room with only about 2 feet of walking space around a queen bed. A small bar fridge and a crappy TV, along with a very small bathroom....welcome to Singapore,land of the rich!Most likely there are some better places around the city for less than $100, however, we paid for not doing our homework and the taxi drivers were no help. Other than no value for your hotel dollar, the place was safe and in an OK area. We enjoyed the restaurant across the street, to the right of the hotel, as it offered multiple food choices at OK prices. A short taxi ride will get you too a nice tourist area by the river. We really liked the cleanliness and the safe aspect of a visit to Singapore, as the city itself would be good to check out for a few days.It's an amazingly clean modern city! The hotels in town however, will eat up your traveling dollar quick and the Hotel 81 left me feeling cheated for my traveling dollar.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rey e
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 2 nights superior room in this hotel. We did not expect much from this hotel since it is a "budget hotel". Upon Check-in the room was dirty, floor was dusty and there are hairs all over the place. It seems the room was never even cleaned. The CR was also dirty, you can see molds in the tiles. The rooms are not cold and even has this moldy smell like a wet basement room that has been not opened for a long time. When we requested for hosekeeping, the guy who went to our room was wearing slippers, his pants folded upto his knees. when we asked him to mop the floor, he got his mop and washed it in our CR and just left the dirty water on the floor. WORST is that their staff are VERY RUDE. When asked some directions it seems they are pissed off. They should not be in this kind of business with their attitude. Please dont stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not good for family tours”
Reviews.Author: chimp_rex
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4d/3n in a Superior Room. We did not expect much as this was a 'budget hotel'. Upon arriving, the room was dusty. Aircon is not that cold and smells funny (stuffy and moldy). Good thing our CR was clean and the tub drain was working. Got pissed off with 2 instances of frustrated theft: Strike No. 1: We bought food in the morning and placed it in the ref so we can eat right away after arriving from the city tour...when we got back, the food was gone! We called frontdesk and the roomboys returned it. Strike No. 2: During our last day, we left our things with the frontdesk just like other guests. We checked out early so we can take a side trip to the zoo. When we got back, we can't find our baby stroller! Took us 30 minutes to plead with the frontdesk to check with other staff. And, they finally found the stroller tucked neatly away behind a cabinet in the staff room. THEY GOT THIEVES AS STAFF! BEWARE! If not for a few very helpful frontdesk staff who helped us with my mom in a wheelchair, I would have rated this hotel terrible. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job”
Reviews.Author: jl877
Reviews.Content: My bf and I booked this a few days before arriving. This was really the only option for us as we were on a budget and hotels in Singapore are outrageously expensive (if you want a good one, that is). I found this hotel to be ok for what we needed. The staff were helpful. Rooms were clean and had the facilities we required- bathroom and air conditioning. It does not have a pool, which is unfortunate since Singapore is so humid. The location was the biggest drawcard for us as it is close to two MRT stations and a walkable distance to many sightseeing spots. There is a food court across the road that is open 24 hrs. This was handy as the hotel doesn't have any facilities to provide breakfast. A 7 eleven was close by as well (always handy for those late night snacks). I was told by a Singaporean friend that this hotel chain is renowned for being used by less than desirable people "by the hour". But he did say that this one seemed reasonable (probably the location it is in). I wouldn't stay here again unless I was absolutely desperate.

Reviews.Title: “The bathroom is terrible!”
Reviews.Author: gpavie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days. I needed because a friend of mine was in front of, in the Bayview Hotel. The bathroom is terrible. The reception isn't friendly. No facility to take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about this hotel is its location - nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Diamargas
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 days in June 2011 because it was central. We arrived late as flights were grounded in Australia due to volcanic ash cloud. Instead of being given a proper twin room as we expected, we had something the size of a cupboard with a strange double bed made of two smaller ones put together. There was not enough space to separate them and they seemed glued in place looking like any double bed. Instead of having a non smoking room as we booked, we had one where people smoked for years and the last person must have smoked in there just a couple of hours before our arrival. We felt instantly sick and nauseated by the stench. This is not a hotel for tourists actually. It’s more like a hostel for foreign workers. It is basic beyond basic, the corridors smell bad of sewage, tobacco, mold and food as people cook meals in their rooms probably – I saw some neighbors coming home with supermarket bags full of vegetables, oil, bread and raw meat. The smell of cooking was everywhere, obviously people lived there for long periods of time. The presentation on the Internet made this hotel look reasonably good, “cheap and clean” – actually the only clean things in it were the sheets on the beds – meaning they were washed - but that was about it. Otherwise, those sheets had patches everywhere and in places they also had holes the size of a penny, not to mention aged stains of rust, ink or bitumen that did not wash off. The elevator was a nightmare – it shut itself on you sharply while your foot was still in the door – literally! Before one had a chance to press any button, no matter how quickly you tried, it took the passenger god knows to what level. The hardest thing was to open its doors – it was purposely set extremely tight, not to open completely for some reason. You had to squeeze out. Therefore we found ourselves with two suitcases left in the corridor while we were taken swiftly 5 levels down with the rest of the luggage, without having a chance to leave the elevator and follow the suitcases. We worried about finding them again a good 10-12 minutes while the elevator collected 5-6 people and took them down 12 floors. When we arrived up again and managed with force to push the door open long enough to get out with the rest of our gear, we found two men examining our suit-cases with interest. At our sight, they made themselves scarce on the fire evacuation stairs. The door of the room did not lock securely. The air conditioning did not work properly but made a lot of noise and blew in a terrible mold stench. The key-card they gave us was only one, not two. It was bent and cracked and once we went out, the air conditioning was off and the tobacco and mold stench still there – more powerful than ever. The windows were primitively and carelessly screwed together with bent rusty bolts, not to be opened ever! (?) The walls had stains and scratches everywhere. The corners had built-up dirt gluing the walls to the floor. The bathroom had built-on scum and grime in between the tiles and in every crevasse. We put our suitcases in the wardrobe – with the way the door opened with just a push even without a card. We had no heart to leave them in full sight. We went out, searched for a while, found ourselves a proper hotel and moved less than 4 hours after arriving there… Do not go there if you can. Your deserve better, I'm sure. Anybody does. This was the worst hotel we ever booked on line, and the first and last time for us to book a "2 star" (LOL!) hotel, especially in a warm, humid country.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AND NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Merisa_naka
Reviews.Content: I had stay there for short vacation.Yes, we paid for expensive room.At the first time when we got inside room.The room had bad smelly from aircondition and day after we got sick..the staff (receptionist and manager) didn't helpfull. and we took 2 rooms ..On 2 rooms was different floors. one room was stay 3 people .and we pay for extra-bed. The extra-bed was like small sofar and movement..it had 2 gaps between extra-bed.We had called to receptionist to ask for extra towel cos i thought they forgot we stayed for 3 people not 2 and paid for room..we didn't stay there for free..anyway,we will visit your country again.For sure, we will never visit this hotel anymore.. Best Regards., Merisa

Reviews.Title: “Fungus and mould on the ceiling.”
Reviews.Author: martha145a
Reviews.Content: Well not much to add. It's grose. When you enter the toilet and you look up you can see fungus coming out of the A/C grid. It still gives me shives, remembering that stay. They must've never cleaned the A/C. The room itself is okay - it's not too small and desent. But the rest is a horror. If you already booked your room (which is super expensive anyway) - buy a screwdriver because they tightened window handles so you cannot turn it to the position to open it. With a window open I survived the stay, otherwise I would rather sleep on the park bench.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: KPKhoo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was within our budget plus it was located near to the Singapore National Museum which was where we were going for an event. So location wise it was perfect. Actually, we had no idea it was just a short walk away. Also, there were the MRT stations plus food was easily available. The room we took was a basic twin so we don't expect much. The separate beds were pushed together but the sheets & blankets were clean enough as were the towels. The staff were nice and helpful, giving us directions when asked. Admittedly, the place looks rather run-down but we don't mind. For those with budgetry contraint, this hotel should be good enough for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good stay. Recommended for those on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: zja_godiva
Reviews.Content: Despite reading not so good reviews about this hotel, we booked 3 superior rooms (each room good for 3 pax) because of the cheap room rates and good location. We were expecting the worst and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't that bad. The superior room had a queen size bed and a sofa bed w/ clean pillows and blankets, (thankfully no bed bugs), mini refrigerator, electric kettle, ample closet space, tv w/ dvd player, and hair dryer. The bathroom although old and needs renovation, was clean and had hot water. The staff were very helpful and cleaned our rooms daily, providing bottled water, 3-in-1 coffee, and towels (although a bit worn out). Across the street, there is 7-11 store and Kopi Tiam which is open 24 hours. If you want the familiar fastfood and coffeshop, just beside the Kopi Tiam are Wendy's and Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf and a few more steps is the Bras Basah MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Passable”
Reviews.Author: littlerock_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel 81 Bencoolen has the greatest location of all Hotel 81 hotel chain. It is near 2 major MRT stations, the Dhoby Ghaut and Bras Basah, near a food court (KopiTiam) and 24-hrs convenience stores. It's somewhat cheap compared to other hotels in the area. There's TV (not flat screen though), a mini ref and cool aircon.It has free 500ml bottled water everyday. Friendly hotel staff - they speak english and filipino. You can ask them the way around Singapore. Free wifi. Woohoo! The biggest drawback for me is the restrooms. Its not as clean as I have expected it to be. The sink has a little punch hole; the rug inside was not changed even though its been soaking in water; no trash can inside the restroom. The cabinet has an old panty that has been hanging inside the cabinet before we arrived, the cleaning lady missed it. I guess it all boils down to the cleaning lady/man. There's fresh towels every day but its kinda old - i think they need to buy new ones. Over all, I will still come back and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Budget with few benefits.”
Reviews.Author: Travlalu
Reviews.Content: It must be taken for granted that hotels are an expensive part of your stay in Singapore.It took us a while to find a place that would accommodate three people but did not break the budget: Hotel 81-Bencoolen did not quite fit the bill in most ways for us.We walked from Dhobi Ghaut MRT station in about 10 minutes and found the surroundings of the hotel to be a clean cityscape with office buildings and numerous cafes and convenience stores.The same can not be said for our hotel room.It was disappointing to see the bathroom with patch up grout around many of the tiles and the room itself was very pokey.We knew that one of the beds would be a converted sofa bed what we didn't know that the sofa was so tiny it found it hard to do double duty as a decent sleeping place.The room generally had a worn out,uncared for feel to it. The saving grace of this hotel is that Singapore on the whole as a city is so pleasant to be in that you can momentarily forget the below par hotel.The hotel was in easy walking distance to Bugis Mall,Little India and other interesting sights like the Sri Krishna temple alongside the Kwan Im Thong Hood Cho Chinese temple.It was a real treat to visit here in the morning observing the tempelgoers with their offerings.There was a lively market place here too with many items on sale for the Chinese New year.By chance we were in Singapore for the New year and it made for a very festive atmosphere all around. The rest of the city we saw via the excellent,clean and extremely efficient metro system as well as the Singapore airlines hop on hop off tour bus.The highlight of the city for us was the magnificent display of orchids in the Botanical Gardens. Even though Hotel 81 is considered a budget hotel ,it's not super cheap and for what we paid we expected a decent,basic standard which we did not get so I can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: vavski
Reviews.Content: good location- near bras basha mrt station, staff helpful but can still improve people skills- these are about the only positive thing i can say for this hotel no breakfast included, small room , not so clean bathroom , and you can really hear the noise outside the room, the linen and towels used have seen better days, no free wi fi

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - reasonable costs”
Reviews.Author: Ajay203
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located just off the Orchard Road and very close to the Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. The advantage of this station is that three lines intersect here. You can go just about anywhere in singapore from this station. Hotel 81 is a typical budget hotel chain. No frills but neat and clean. Though this hotel is not in the CBD (where the red light district is) there is still a steady traffic of young men and women during the evenings who rent the rooms on an hourly basis. This may bother some families. However there there is no soliciting and the hotel staff is very matter of fact about handling this traffic. If you look the other way it should not bother you. The Hotel rooms are pretty tiny and the beds are encased in cheat leather. The staff is helpful and courteous. At around 120 SGD for a deluxe room and with the great location, the shortcomings can be overlooked. We had a great stay, especially as we were out of the Hotle most of the time and returned only to sleep in. Would recommend this to budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel For Budget Travellers With Great Location..”
Reviews.Author: akuasyad
Reviews.Content: One of the best location hotel in singapore.. very convenient.. the hotel is quite good.. with a nice bed.. didnt had any bad experience with the bed bugs.. the services is normal.. very good hotel for muslims travellers.. near mosque n easy to look for halal foods.. Hajah Maimunah Restaurant.. nice n tasty foods.. near the food court also.. got 7-11 infront of the hotel... few minutes walk to Bras Basah MRT.. 10-15 minutes walk to Bugis Street.. 20 minutes walk to Orchard Road... n please dont expect too much for the hotel quality n services.. bcoz its not a 5 star hotel... but i'll definitely stay here again in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Floral2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to it's proximity to a function we were attending. Overall, it was a lot better than what we expected. The room that we got (on the 7th floor) was clean (our number 1 priority!) and the bed was comfortable (we didn't get the bugs reported here, thank goodness!) The bathroom is very small but we don't spend a lot of time in there so it was ok. The new bras basah mrt is just a few minutes walk away. Dont use the douby ghout one as reported in some online sources (including the hotels own website as its further!) Our main gripes are the thin walls and the noisy aircon.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly terrible...Disgusting hotel on Earth!!!! Yuckiness”
Reviews.Author: Jenkittychua
Reviews.Content: Not worth for the value of mone,the bathroom is terrible smelly and the tiny,dirty,smelly rooms is terribly disgusting...location is ok very near the 24hrs convinient food court and 7/11 store.But the hotel itself is a BIG no no no!!!! Will not coming back again. Maybe will try Strand or Bayview hotel much better i guess!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is located at very nice area...”
Reviews.Author: prakruti_shah
Reviews.Content: I went for marketing of my company's services & stayed at Hotel 81 bencoolen street. It was quite in to my budget.. I didnt want to stay on 4-5star property.. Bencoolen street was very pose.. Exactly opp to hotel, there was a food bazaar where i got my veg food to eat...Even Little india was not far away from my hotel. It was 10mins by taxi.. i stayed there for 6days.. overall it was good experience..

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service and Terrible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tiners
Reviews.Content: Yes, this was a budget hotel, but it doesn't mean that it can't be comfortable. They lack security, customers are not given the kind of service that is basic in any hotel (e.g.: help with luggage, hailing a cab, greetings), the walls are not soundproof (prepare to wake up at the middle of the night!!!) and the bathroom makes it worst. Customers should get value for their money but unfortunately, this hotel just doesn't give such.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: yaneal
Reviews.Content: Although this is a budget hotel, there is no excuse for the rooms smelling like damp and the bathrooms being full of mould. I could hardly bear to be in the bathroom with its mouldy ceiling, mouldy shower curtain and filthy dirty extractor fan. Budget doesn't have to mean dirty and run down. Budget can have a fresh lick of paint but still be cheap. I felt utterly grimey staying here and would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming cheapness”
Reviews.Author: jcn_uk
Reviews.Content: I decided to go "budget", since I was staying less than 20 hours in Singapore, and was impressed with the reviews of the 81 Bencoolen. I am fully aware that the 81 is a budget chain, but in my mind, so is the Ibis, and I am always very comfortable at any Ibis. Well, compared to the 81, an Ibis hotel is pure five-star luxury. I agree with the reviews that say the room is very clean. If a clean room, (besides the great location), is THE ONLY consideration when booking a hotel, go ahead and book the 81 Bencoolen. It is clean, but even a clean place can be below “basic”. The cheapness of the place is overwhelming. Now, if you are like me, have outgrown the young adventurer in you, and consider that the place you sleep is, for at least one night, a proxy of your home, you surely want a bit more than that. For about £20 more you can stay at the brand new Parc Sovereign (please see the review), or for £30 more you can stay at the Ibis Bencoolen. And frankly, if £20 or £30 makes a difference, maybe you should skip Singapore altogether. There is no place on earth I like more than Singapore, but hotels here are expensive, and that is something you need to factor in. The positive note about the hotel is its location. The Bencoolen area is great for restaurants, shopping, and it is very central.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price..great location..”
Reviews.Author: Ilfan
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms..our request for a side by side room was granted during check in. (The request was not confirmed prior to arrival via phone or email). We stayed in with 1 infant and 1 child (3yo). Check in was smooth and fast, the room was small but clean. The reception girl was polite and gave some sweets to the children. For a budget hotel staff courtesy is good. It was our first visit in SIN as family...location is great...Kopi Tiam offers 24 hours food service and next to it is 7eleven. Both are just right across the street. Bras Basah MRT station is within 5 minutes walk maximum.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty small but nice location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Nadoublet
Reviews.Content: The room is quite small, the door lock seems to be loose and we need to call the operator everytime in order to ask them to transfer the line to our friend in another room, which is quite inconvenience.. But the service is good, those at front desk are very helpful.. And the best thing is this hotel is very very near to Bras Basah station, just 5 mins walk! :)

Reviews.Title: “This place makes me quiver”
Reviews.Author: js0n1
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel during a late night 1 day stopover in Singapore, based on the recommendation of a taxi driver when I asked about a "cheap hotel." From now on I'm gonna just fork out the extra $50 or so. The room was small and looked really seedy and everything about it looked very unhygienic. Also, with no ventilation the your room fills up with cigarette smoke from other stayers. The walls are paper thin so you can hear every door close, every conversation and the televisions of other rooms. We checked in at about 2am and got to sleep at about 3am.. only to be woken up by construction work two buildings across at about 5-6am, which the hotel couldn't help of course... but the drilling sound echoed so loudly though our room. However this place maybe your cup of tea if you're really on a budget. Also, you're practically a street away from a hub of working girls from Vietnam, which can be good or bad depending on your intentions and desires. A big factor influencing my opinion on this hotel, is I paid less for a high quality 4star hotel in Bangkok.

Reviews.Title: “hotel81- bencoolen”
Reviews.Author: CawieCee
Reviews.Content: room size is ok and clean, very near to marina and bus stops, 7-11 and wendy's across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're desperate for a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: apester
Reviews.Content: we had to suddenly extend our trip in singapore for one night and were hard-pressed to find a hotel. i had remembered a friend mentioning the hotel 81 chain and so i booked this particular location largely because of its cheap rate at the last minute. no i know the hotel 81 chain is composed of budget hotels, but even so i do feel they should make more of an effort to make the hotel better rather than just rely on good location. first of all, the hotel smelled bad - old and moldy. the sheets had holes, the sink was stained. these are things that are not impossible nor very costly to remedy. the ambience of the room was more like that of a seedy motel than a hotel. the front desk staff was nice and helpful enough, but it took over half an hour for 2 towels to get sent up to our room. surely that wasn't too hard to do. but everything about hotel 81 on bencoolen reminded us that we went cheap. strange sounds from the vents, noisy airconditioning, thin towels... surely there must be a way to go budget and still have a decent place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, miserable service”
Reviews.Author: Donelmono
Reviews.Content: We were so happy to have been able to book so closely to the centre of the city with a superb food court just across the street. Everything was accessible which was a big convenience. Wehad a museum just a stone's throw away and shuttle bus stops to parks were just a walk away. The location was precious. The room was quite functional which provided just the right space for 3 adults and a child. However, I cannot help but take note of the rust stained counter top and the peeled off paintings of the walls of our room which was saddening. As we were usually out doing our sight-seeing, that was not much of a concern for us as other guests would. The stairs carpet at the entrance is always dirty in the 4 days we stayed there. It is in need of serious shampooing already. What bothers me most is the inconsistent and generally poor service rendered by the hotel. We were welcomed by a warm Filipina who was quite accommodating but was not that knowledgeable about the area yet (probably a room for improvement for the managers on staff knowledge) when asked where a good money changer is and way to's to Singapore's main tourist attractions. The following day when I asked for bottled water to be replenished, I was abruptly told that I am only entitled to 2 bottles a day. I had to remind them that I was paying for 3 for them to say "okay" without even a sorry. Last and most frustratingly, I left a small parcel which I hand-carried from my country to SG at the Front Desk and gave specific instructions to safekeep it as it will be picked up by my former colleague whose full name and contact details i wrote in English script should it be left uncollected. I was surprised to be told that the item had been mistakenly sent up to my previous room due to a "miscommunication" between their staff as explained by Dennis Tung, their Duty Manager. I had to call them from home as I was not even informed that the items were lost. Moreover, my colleague also told me that he was asked by a Melvin why he did not pick up the item on time. I'm lucky that it was not our land title or my colleague's medicines on that parcel that got "lost". Next time we book, we will check out the other hotels in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Good location / Good for the budget”
Reviews.Author: KarlWetterman
Reviews.Content: Hotel 81 - Bencoolen is just right on the budget-conscious traveler. Since my wife and I had a packed schedule in SG, we knew that our stay in the hotel was just to get enough sleep and a place to shower. The location is good since it is near the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Okay. That's It.”
Reviews.Author: gabnatpris
Reviews.Content: For budget hotel, it is quite expensive. The room is so small, the floor was sticky (I dont know why), ants everywhere, and the air con is super noisy. The parking lot in the basement is limited which can only accommodate 12-15 cars I guess. But the location is quite good. There's a 7-Eleven and Kopitiam just across the street,15 mins walk to Orchard Street, and less than 5 mins to The Cathay.

Reviews.Title: “"I Dont mind staying again but-I'll try some other Hotel- "”
Reviews.Author: buttercup42
Reviews.Content: the hotel is handy to bugis, orchard , mrt, kopitaim..staff can speak english, rooms have windows not dark and eerie looks clean and no smell..the room size is reasonable for the price, the bedding looks clean, but they don't seem to change it on a daily basis like Marriott and other 4 & 5 star hotels does, it looks clean ,but we can tell that it hasn't been changed since the last guest, As there are some hair, and pubic hair left in the bedding...we are so tired from our trip from Malaysia, ..that instead of requesting for a bedding change, I had covered the bedding with the bed linens I bought from Malaysia..I don't make so much fuss so long as I can tolerate the smell of the room , which this one doesn't ,..I don't mind staying in this hotel again..but I'd rather try somewhere else..which I did in my next visit the Park View Hotel ..terrible never again,.. Hotel 81 in comparison to Park View is better in ambience , cleanliness, location is the same..am back in Singapore soon this time I will try Bay View just across Hotel 81 which looks nice from outside..

Reviews.Title: “Location is its best selling point”
Reviews.Author: sailorsim
Reviews.Content: Hotel 81 Bencoolen has the advantage of being situated in a somewhat central and good location. It's nearby convenience stores, 24-hour eateries, bus stops and the Bras Basah MRT (exit D). Other hotels along the same street are Hotel Bencoolen, Strand Hotel, City Bayview, Hotel Ibis and Summerview. As you might expect, Hotel 81 Bencoolen offers the lowest rates. With that said, I'm sure they can do to hire more dedicated staff. Or perhaps all they need is a more competent manager to set an example. I observed that the highest-leveled person was curtly answered walk-in customers queries with an abrupt "no more rooms!" reply. The rooms are very spartan, as expected for a hotel of this class. Sound-proofing is non-existent. In the room, i found a cramped double-bed, a small 1 liter kettle, fridge, hair-dryer, body soap/shampoo dispenser and an old TV set. Housekeeping punishes people who sleep in. I stayed here for 2 nights, but not once was my room made-up. I suspect that they only go on their room-cleaning rounds in the early mornings. If you miss that time slot, you're out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , many food courts,7Eleven & MRT nearby”
Reviews.Author: macrossworks
Reviews.Content: There are 2 food courts right opposite the hotel and a MRT round the corner. There is another foodcourt at another lane -5minutes drive and a Dome Cafe near the Art Museum. Many art shops or museams and only 1 shopping centre round the corner

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K. Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicbruin
Reviews.Content: This is a middle-of-the-road hotel, not too pretentious, but well located and close to Orchard Road. Singapore is a very expensive city and this hotel is as good value as it gets in this area. On the other hand, the staff is a bit rude, the furnishings a bit old and dated, and the atmosphere not very inviting. One can do better, but if you are looking just for value and location, this could be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Barliansyah
Reviews.Content: I just stayed on this hotel for 3 nights (Jun 26 ~29) and made reservation through holidaycity.com. The location was good, near from the basic necessity, such as money changer, mosque, food, MRT (Dhoby Ghaut and Bras Basah) and some museum (National Museum & Art Museum). The hotel's facility only basic, TV channel limited but still kept clean. If you want to look for hotel in good location and near by other necessity could be considered.

Reviews.Title: “REASONABLE HOTEL IN GOOD LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: nirmayuliansyah
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights during Holiday Season for the Broadcastasia event, booked via Booking.com for 2 rooms. We arrived early and they had one room ready only, an upgraded one ;) , and they gave the room to us, and another one later. If none of the rooms hadn't been ready either, they allowed us to put the luggages in their lobby. The location is very convenient, a money changer right beside the building, 24 hours food court with lovely food and 7 Eleven Mart across the road, local restaurants also across the road, bus station too, and Bras Basah MRT station down the corner, 3-4 minutes walk, Shopping Center and Dhalby Ghaut MRT Station (the biggest interchange station) 10 minutes walk. The room is neat and clean enough, with aged furnitures and bathroom interior, but compared to the location and price, it is very good choice, especially if you stay in hotel only for short time sleep. The Air Conditioner works well, hot water as well. It has small fridge too. I would stay here again whenever I come to S'pore.

Reviews.Title: “good bugget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jakrapop
Reviews.Content: We stay there for 2 nights staff friendly but not Rf in standard room , good location not too far from Orchard road

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozzietripper
Reviews.Content: Good for the budget conscious even though lots of things wrong with it. Cold showers due to invertly switching wrong button and small rooms and aged looking wash basins. Location was very good. We were asked to more rooms due to mis management and asked to sign a luggage liability form which meant if our luggage went missing, it was at our cost not theirs even thou they made us move rooms. the luggage was then placed in the common lobby for anyone to access not that they did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeethaBOM
Reviews.Content: Good location..only 5 mins away from Dhoby Ghaut MRT. Great way to connect in and around SIN. Staff ar courteous and polite. Only hitch being no breakfast was served.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and clean with great location and decent price, would go back.”
Reviews.Author: misssunshineuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore for 4 days over a weekend and turned up at the Hotel 81 Bencoolen at 5am without booking beforehand. The staff we excellent at finding us rooms. I paid $119 for a Superior plus room and my friend had a standard room at $99 per night. Even when I complained that one of the rooms smelt a bit smoky the staff fell over themselves to find us another room. Really good service. The hotel was clean, and in a great location in walking distance of Orchard Road. the MRT, bus stops, Boogis Street, the Singapore national museum and the Singapore art museum. Taxi stop, 7/11, eateries and food stalls very near/opposite the hotel. My room as the superior plus had a cable for 24 hr internet access, DVD player, fridge, cable TV and a bath. The room was the same sort of standard of that of an older Travel lodge in the UK. My friends standard room was slightly smaller in size - but ever so slightly and didn’t have the internet access included. Both rooms had aircon. Apparently some of the standard rooms just have showers rather than baths. Rooms include complimentary shower gel, combs, toothbrush, soap, towels, hot water, TV, hairdryer, tea and coffee facilities and 2 bottles of water. Personally unless you want the in room internet access I think a standard room was perfectly adequate. There are computers/internet for guests use in the lobby area. The hotel was clean and room service was good. I never had any problems with noise and had a great stay. Bedding was clean and comfortable. We did use the hotel more as a place to sleep rather than somewhere to spend time in, usually leaving by 10.30am to go out and find breakfast and returning at night, but I would have been happy to spend time watching a DVD or movie there. We would definitely use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: NZTraveller666
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the staff: friendly and helpful under very difficult conditions. In a place like Singapore with its tropical temperature one would expect a fridge to be a standard in every room. Not in this hotel. On arrival at 1a.m. I was handed the key to my room and sent on my way to find my room. Having found it, I couldn't find the fridge, just an empty space where there should have been one. Rang the front desk; 'No, standard rooms don't have a fridge but I can upgrade you to a superior room for an extra $10 per night.' The fridge was the only difference between the two rooms (except the 'superior' room also had an unusable balcony). There was no comfortable chair to sit in, just a round 'pouffe' type stool or the bed. No information in the room about TV programmes, hotel facilities (non-existant so didn't really matter) or tourist information. For a non-smoking room there were many cigarette burns in the bathroom sink and on the vanity top. The toilet flushed only every second time and there was a permanent drip coming through the bathroom ceiling. The 'beverages included' amounted to one sachet of pre-mixed Milo and one of coffee per day. No milk. The creamer is in the pre-mix. The fridge in the 'superior' room had so much ice around the freezer compartment I couldn't open the door. It was this function I really wanted so that I could freeze some ice cubes to put in my water for my next day's touring. So I defrosted it myself and took the huge lump of ice down to reception to show them. They said 'Sorry'. The bed was the hardest I have ever slept on, with a vinyl covered mattress and threadbare sheets that barely fit. Turn over once and the bottom sheet had rumpled up leaving me to lie on the bare vinyl. And don't ask me about breakfast! YUK. This hotel has no restaurant of its own so breakfast is in a nightclub next door which is even seedier than Hotel 81. The access is through the night-club which smells of stale tobacco and burning incence, and 'tastefully' decorated in red and black. Overcooked frankfurters, solid scrambled eggs, sticky noodles and baked beans. Packet orange-flavoured cordial and coffee. All of it stone cold and tasting gross. All in all, grossly overpriced although in a handy location. Please, please, don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Choose it as a last chance!”
Reviews.Author: SuhaGuvenc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 81 Bencoolen for one night. I don't want to speak ill of it much but I highly recommend to all who thinks of this hotel, please try another first, if you cannot, then take it as a last chance and stay there as less as you can. The hotel has a great location with its disadvantages. For example when you turn to hotel at night late, you might face with transvestites and men inside. Even worse, my room was not totally clean and I could see "ants"all over dress table and floor. Also the glass which they gave for drink water was dirty too. Air condition system was a kind of rubbish and no need any word for bathroom! Staff at reception was not friendly. But housekeeping staff was cheerful and friendly. The only thing that I liked with this hotel was its location.

Reviews.Title: “Next door to a pick up bar”
Reviews.Author: Andrew39
Reviews.Content: when the airport shuttle dropped us off (1.00am) our attention was drawn to a woman lying unconscious on the pavement near the entrance. Shortly after we had some food at the food mall across the street. This mall was crowded with what looked like pimps and prostitutes on there snack break. We were kept awake most of the night by men bringing there hire partners back to there rooms.The plastic coated mattress was a little uncomfortable to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible dirty bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: nemtudom
Reviews.Content: The clean room and bathroom is a basic requirement in a hotel even without any stars!!! here the maid forgot to clean the bathroom, I assume! dirt and hairs were all over the bath, in the tube, on the floor, on the table! however the bed was clean. The walls are soooo thin, that I thought they were made of paper! the location is good, mainly for those clients staying for 1-2 hours with a local 'lady'. I wouldn't go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: meowcsj
Reviews.Content: I believe it is the best hotel location at the end of Orchard at bugis vicinity for its price. It is small but clean. The lowest price clean hotel with good location in that area. Expect a decent sleep, nothing luxurious. Across the road is 7 eleven and 24hr food court. Walking distance to bugis MRT, City Hall MRT and duoby ghuat MRT. Just a few bus stop away from Orchard Road. I would recommend to budget travellers who prefer a basic decent hotel to a guesthouse or inn.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazaegurlie14
Reviews.Content: While reading the reviews for this hotel before going to Singapore, I already expected the worse since i've already booked my reservations. If you set your expectations that it is a budget hotel then you won't expect too much. Staff is okay though the bell boys(or electricians) are not wearing uniform. I chose a standard room and to my surprise it was neat and groomed. The toilet is so-so, what's important is the hot and cold shower and clean toilet bowl. I was able to sleep well since i'm on the 7th floor. The hallway was narrow. The elder staff got me the nice room and even gave me two tickets to the river cruise. Overall experience - average.

Reviews.Title: “S$160 worth of filth per night”
Reviews.Author: paulcnz
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Upon check in there was a mysterious liquid spilt on the floor right outside my door, it trailed away towards the lifts suggesting a split cleaners’ bag carting off God knows what. During my first evening in the room I noticed the soles of my feet turning black, upon closer inspection there was grime, hair and dust everywhere (I asked for the floor to be cleaned, which it must have been because my feet only turned brown the next day). There was dried up crud on the table and a box of tissues that either had a bunch either un-artistically arranged by housekeeping, or were simply used ones jammed back in the box by a previous occupant – I decided not to investigate that further. The things we must touch such as light switches and power points were filthy but may be useful if any one ever wishes to carbon-date the last time the room was cleaned. The air conditioning unit dripped water and a black ooze. Air conditioning units are like diapers, when they leak or discharge crud, they probably need some attention. I don't know what sort of guests Hotel 81 anticipates, but I'm not sure if I was grateful for, or repulsed by the vinyl covered mattress that repelled sheets for an uncomfortable night's sleep. The bathroom proved to be a treat too. The toilet seat was broken and there was a discarded sanitary pad bag behind the toilet. I would have thought that the broken seat would have given housekeeping easy access to the crud that was there, but they appear to have ignored this great opportunity. There was no shower curtain, which probably explains why the bathroom floor was quite clean compared to the room, that is, apart from previous occupants’ hair both on the floor and in the bath – helpful at a crime scene I suppose, but not appreciated in a hotel room. And there was the mystery of just what was leaking from the bathroom above. If you are not a fan of cleanliness or hygiene, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated Hotel, Check Other Options”
Reviews.Author: prizms
Reviews.Content: had i know earlier, i would have stayed in this quaint apartment that i discovered near sommerset mrt station which is cheaper and has a common kitchen where you can heat food. rates are cheaper and place is cleaner, across is a chain of small restaurants and grocery. we booked online for a 5 night stay. although i was fore warned about the unfriendly frontdesk staff, i was surprised that they were quite receptive, considering it was the convention week, which btw has a rack rate of a whopping S$260! first two nights were okay, considering we were given a room with a balcony. the nightmare started on the 3rd day onwards when we requested frontdesk to tell housekeeping to clean the bathroom floor and replace the tissue bos we used up. everyday that we called for the bathroom cleanup until the day we left, it was not cleaned leaving it with a stench smell that we had to endure at night during sleep. note that houskeepers clean only during the day when we are out.frontdesk would always say yes to our request but we come home to a bathroom reeking of smell and the tissue box never came. you may want to forgo the free breakfast offer and opt for a cheaper rate, bec they don't change the food at all. its rice,eggs, sausage and beans every single day. a 24 hr fastfood is just across the street for a hot, reasonable meal. other than cleanliness, staff were accommodating to our other requests just didn't understand the bathroom thing. during our stay, i discovered a quaint apartment near sommerset mrt station which is cheaper and has a common kitchen where you can heat food. rates are cheaper and place is cleaner, across is a chain of small restaurants and grocery. next time i will surely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the room's a bit cramped though. Overall, I give the hotel a B-”
Reviews.Author: sobe01
Reviews.Content: I was actually a bit apprehensive, with the not so rosy reviews posted by some of the travellers who stayed at Hotel 81 Bencoolen. But surprisingly, my parents and I had a pretty okay time at the hotel. Of course, we knew that we were not getting first class service, unlike those who previously stayed there. Anyway, we were actually impressed with the location of the hotel since it is right in the middle of the city. Most of the fancy museums, schools and decent eateries cafes are within easy reach. Orchard Road is practically 10 to 15 minutes away by foot. Regarding the room were we slept (we stayed on the 9th floor), it was VERY basic and quite cramped, considering that we chose the Triple, which was good for three adults. However, it was still okay since the amenities were complete and thank god, in okay condition. The bathroom was alright, bigger than what we've expected. Needs a little maneuvering though if you want to take a bath since the shower is "handheld." Overall, we had a decent stay, but housekeeping, UNFORTUNATELY, was a big letdown. I'm not really sure if they know how to clean as the beddings were ALWAYS haphazardly "arranged", and the floors, not properly swept. Another thing, the walls are kinnda thin, so we sort of heard the footsteps and converstaions of those staying next door. But the "noise" did not bother us that much as we only went back late at night at we're just too tired and sleepy to complain.

Reviews.Title: “What A Nightmare !”
Reviews.Author: vjtk2808
Reviews.Content: During my 5-days stay at Hotel 81 Bencoolen, a purportly claimed 3 star hotel, I found unbelievable that the hotel's housekeepers did not use vacuum cleaner while tidy up rooms. Therefore, rooms were full of hair, dust and even tissue paper. Ants were found all over the dressing table, wash basin and sometimes on the bed. I just wonder how such a hotel obtain it's ISO certificate and is it a room worth USD100+ is about in Singapore ?

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: koolmanLondon
Reviews.Content: In the past, I haven*t bothered about staying hotels like 81, 69 or wahtever. But at the helm of Air Show, all the other available hotel rooms were $300, 400, 500, 700 and more (per night) and we had no choice but to stay at Hotel 81Bancoolen. After reading the other comments, we were ready for dirty floor, dirty shower room and poor service. The impression changed after 1 night, - not too bad. It is in a central location - walking distance to Orchard, Ruffles, Suntec and few minites walk to MRT station if you are heading out further. The decent local restaurant <Kopitiam> is just across the road and Sevel-Eleven as well. The hotel staff does not bother you and house keeping is good. There is a hair dryer, internet connection, free bottle of water in the room. So we have ended up staying here for thye rest of the stay in Singapore. After all, it is what you expect and if the stay is value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if..”
Reviews.Author: tyara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights from the 26th to the 30th of December. 2 pax, me and my best friend. This is our first time staying in a budgeted hotel. All in all, so so.. Very much a budget hotel. The check in process was very slow although we already had our vouchers in hand. No roomboy to help, we have to drag our suitcases by ourselves, which was no problem on check in, but a big problem on checkout (we shopped a lot during our stay). The room was unbelievably cramped, we literally have to jump over suitcases just get to the other side of the room. Floor was dusty and to my surprise the pillowcases in our bed were made of some kind of disposable material which reminds me of a kleenex tissue. Bathroom was okay, a bit bigger than I expected since the room was very very small. Nice and clean. The thing is, I really don't recommend guests who bring children to come here. It could get nasty and scary at nights. You get to see hookers, drunken men and even transvestites.. Eeeyoughh.. The good thing about the hotel is the location. Very good location. It's close to Dhoby Ghaut MRT (one of the biggest MRT station in Singapore) -- about 5 mins walk, and located just in front of the Kopi Tiam foodcourt which opens 24 hours a-day, a 7/11 also is close by. Bus stop in front of the hotel and buses going through Bencoolen mostly can take us to major touristic and shopping site in Singapore. So if you plan to travel like us, which is went out of the hotel at 9, back at 4 for a quick shower then off again until midnight (we spent the day exploring Singapore), this is your place. But if you plan to enjoy any luxury (there is none by the way), then find someplace else..

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Awful”
Reviews.Author: nicall
Reviews.Content: Generally uncomfortable experience. Door lock broken. Hotel Internet broken. Bar of soap in bathroom? Not available. Bedside reading light? You must be joking. Interesting black mould between tiles in bath/shower. Worst of all. the mattress had a horrible plastic cover, which provided the distinct impression of sleeping on an incontinence sheet. These things might be bearable in a budget hotel, but at a minimum SGD159 per night it wasn't even particulary cheap. One night of this and I headed next door to the Bencoolen Hotel. Same price, but welcoming and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with Location Advantage”
Reviews.Author: swapnali26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 8 - 11 Nov on the 11 Floor in a DBL room. Had not expected much from the property, hence was not shocked. Room was small, but comfortable bed for 2 adt n 1 child. The room was not sparkling clean, as there was lot of dust on the floor corners and behind the TV. Everyday a bottle of water, 1 cup noodles, coffee/milo sachets were provided in the room. Daily toothbrush and shower caps were replenished. The choice was made based on the hotel location. Orchard Rd, Suntec City, Sim lim square, city hall are all within a walking distance of 10 - 15 mins. Dhoby Gaut MRT is 10 mins away. Also was a bit sceptical about the night activities in the hotel as trvlg with a small daughter, but was pleasantly surprised to find none. The breakfast is local buffet breakfast with bread and butter being served, though we never had bf at the hotel, as there was a small hawker centre opposite and kopitiam, delifrance arnd the corner. Will recommend this property for budget family travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: My0
Reviews.Content: Wound up at this hotel after looking for a room not to expensive but in a decent shape - something really hard to find in Singapore. I was quite pleased when seeing the room, fairly new and modern with a view over the singapore skyline, but I quickly realised that it was not very clean on floors and the bathroom was a bit shabby. Overall though I must say that it is good value in Singapore standards, and I would probably return next time.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel?”
Reviews.Author: chye82
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular at Bencoolen 81 over the past 3 years. Either for a weekend getaway with my girlfriend, or checking in for 2 hour transits, just to have some quality time with my girlfriend. Standards more or less remains the same over the years, with only one thing that is changing. The price of the rooms. The rooms are getting pricer each year, and now the prices even varies on weekends or public holidays. Previously the rates are standard. SG$20 for transit SG$79-89 per night. However prices now range from SG$30 for transit and $119-$150. Sometimes I wonder am i still checking into a budget hotel anymore, with the ever growing prices. But I will still go back to the hotel mainly for a few reasons. Location is good as it is walking distance from town, making it easy to make plans. Room is clean, with adequate facilities (hairdryer, thermal flask, television with cable channels, bathtub, etc) Pay $10 to get a DVD player room, although chances are you will have a spoilt remote, or the lack of one.

Reviews.Title: “good for value”
Reviews.Author: ajai
Reviews.Content: for budget travelers, this is one of the cheapest available and located within walking distance to malls and subway. basic amenities are provided, however the quality match back with the price. what more can you expect!! oh, complimentary parking provided.

Reviews.Title: “Short time hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarlosMakati
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at 1am. We are a family 3 Adults, 1 child and 1 baby. To our surprise, the rooms were not yet ready and subject for cleaning. We noticed a male with two transvestite prostitute waiting for a room while another prostitute was requesting for a key. Discusting. At night time its a short time hotel and our rooms were rented out to others before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: okim
Reviews.Content: part of the hotel 81 group that offers comfortable, clean, modern and affordable rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. prices £32/£36 per night. Goes up a bit on a saturday.

Reviews.Title: “It was our first time in a budget hotel...”
Reviews.Author: pinayflashpacker
Reviews.Content: and it will probably be our last. We stayed one night on a 5th floor room and another on a 7th floor room. We got a room on the 5th floor when we arrived in Singapore (on the way to Krabi, Thailand). It was big enough with a big enough toilet and bath plus a balcony. Back from our trip, there were no more balcony rooms (despite our previous reservation) so we got a room on the 7th floor. We barely fit in the room with our luggage. We keep on bumping our feet and arms/ hands on the wall, bed posts, etc. There was definitely no space to move around. The toilet and bath was half the size of the previous room. Rooms were clean. Both baths didn’t have shower panels or curtains thus it gets flooded when one is taking a shower. They do have hot water. You also get a cup noodle, milo, 3 in 1 coffee and a bottle of water; water thermos/ boiler also available in the room. Halls in the 5th floor smells like a laboratory. Check-in and check-out were quick and fuss-free. We were able to leave our luggage for storage for free after check-out. Location was excellent; train stations, convenience stores, coffee shops, malls nearby. Prices were SG$129 (5th floor room- holiday rate) and SG$109 (7th floor room- regular rate). It was acceptable although I did not expect it to be like that looking at the pictures on their website. If you do decide to stay there, it would be best to get a balcony room. Also bring your email confirmation for your reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel said that they did not have a booking for me (despite my having proof from Opodo) but they found a room for me in Hotel 81. This was just about the only hotel room left in Singapore and I soon found out why. I was propositioned by a prostitute in the lift on the way up to my room and that set the tone for my stay. The hallway on the tenth floor was covered with cigarette ends. Always suspicious of dirty hotels I turned down the top bedsheets in my smelly room to find a very stained sheet with a couple of hairs. I got that changed pretty quickly, but with no apologies from the staff. The bathroom was covered in cigarette burns and the shower would only point at the wall, so I had to shower one handed. There was no shower curtain or screen so the floor got soaked. I went out for the evening and returned at around 12 to hear that there was an orgy happening on my floor. At least it sounded like that, with lots of screams and groans going on through the night. Oh yes, and the guy who wrote the previosu review is right about the lights. There are no switches by the bed. Ridiculous! What a grott hole and not cheap at Sing $160. Do not take your family there. And yes, they really do rent rooms by the hour!!!
